events.message: The claimant reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of April 30th, 2024, involving their car and another party at a traffic intersection.
The claim was categorized under ‘Auto Accident’ after review of the initial report, confirming the incident involved the insured’s car.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claimant’s case to assist with further communication and processing of the vehicle accident claim.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the claimant that the review process has started promptly.
The claimant was requested to submit photographs of the vehicle damage along with the police accident report and repair estimates.
All requested documents including the police report, vehicle photos, and repair shop estimates were submitted by the claimant within the deadline.
The investigation team began reviewing the claim details, documents, and evidence to determine liability and the extent of damages.
The investigation was completed with findings confirming fault and damage estimates aligning with the submitted documentation.
A settlement proposal was sent to the claimant offering full coverage of the repair costs and compensation for rental vehicle expenses.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the timely and fair handling of the claim.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance adjuster after the claimant’s acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment for the approved settlement was processed and issued to the claimant to cover car repairs and associated expenses.
The insurance claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation that the claimant was satisfied with the resolution.
